description: sketchy, unfinished; two figures; left figure reclines on cloud; right figure with arms out, PR hand touching arm of left figure; legs of right figure redrawn several times--figure has four legs
dimension:
5 7/16 x 7 7/16 in. (13.81 x 18.89 cm) (sheet, irregular)
15 3/4 x 19 3/4 in. (40.01 x 50.17 cm) (outer frame)
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash on laid paper
provenance: Dr. E. I. Schapiro, London. [Colnaghi, London, 1956]. [F. A. Drey, London]. Sale, Christie's, London, November 21, 1967, no. 21. Lili Froehlich-Bum, London. Sale, Sotheby's, London, December 11, 1975, no. 83, bought in; aftersale, Sotheby's, London, January 3, 1976, for £275, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1976-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Diana and Eolus
